parameters.name: q
parameters.description: covered by filters?

post.summary:
on create, we should accept service and all parameters that correspond to it,
priority have the fields that were directly set from the front-end and if they are empty we should
fill them from service (we can't change the SLA and SLA conditions)
etag doesn't play any role on this API

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Result fields to include in the response.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of catalogs or search catalogs

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number for pagination

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of records per page

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Fields to be retrieved as a result.
If the user passes "-" as the value for fields,
it will retrieve all available fields for each catalog.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorting options by fields

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: List of IDs to filter the catalogs

parameters.name: q.query
parameters.description:
Search query string for filtering by name. Supports:
- Wildcards (*) for substring matching
- Placeholder (?) for single character substitution
- Exact match for full names

parameters.name: q.fetch_type
parameters.description:
The type of data fetching for catalog services

 - PARTIAL: Only essential fields like [ Id, Name, Description, Created/Updated at ].

Partial info includes only essential fields.
 - FULL: The fetch type indicates whether to retrieve
all available data for the catalog ( FULL ) or only essential fields ( PARTIAL ).

Full info includes all fields of the catalog.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Filter by state (true for active, false for inactive)

parameters.name: depth
parameters.description:
Filter by the depth of the hierarchy to retrieve services.
The depth indicates how many ancestor levels of services
will be included for each catalog.
- A depth of 0 includes only the direct catalog.
- A depth of 1 includes the catalog and its immediate services.
- By default the depth is unlimited,
  meaning all nested services and sub-services will be included.

get.summary: With Case

The related cases can be obtained bidirectionally as child or parent, but we should consider them from the perspective of the requested case, by inverting their connection type
Requested case always a parent and related cases a children

delete.summary:
on delete, we should require etag, to understand if user has right version of the case
also will be deleted all objects connected to the case, such as comments, related cases, links and files

parameters.name: etag
parameters.description: identifier of the object

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: fields to return in deleted object

put.summary:
on update, we should be able to accept service and all parameters that correspond to it,
if service and corresponding to it fields were changed simultaneously then priority have
service and dependent fields set from the service automatically (we can't change the SLA, SLA conditions )
etag is required to update the true version of the case

parameters.name: input
parameters.description: changes

assignee.title: create: not required, default from service or set by UI;

reporter.title: create: required (if empty recognize as anonymous contact);

impacted.title: create: required, default is reporter or ui (if empty recognize as anonymous);

group.title: create: not required, default from service or set by UI;

status.title: create: not required, default initial value from status lookup or ui;

priority.title: create: not required, default first value from priority lookup

service.title: on this field base many other readonly fields on return

close.title: create: not required; update: required only when case status goes to the final state

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: fields to return in resulting object

patch.summary:
on update, we should be able to accept service and all parameters that correspond to it,
if service and corresponding to it fields were changed simultaneously then priority have
service and dependent fields set from the service automatically (we can't change the SLA, SLA conditions )
etag is required to update the true version of the case

etag.title: main field required for read, update and delete

name.title: name of the case, formed by the prefix defined in Catalog and int, in docs uses as id

contact_info.title: free-form text to describe contact information

planned_reaction_at.title: planned reaction time calculated by sla and conditions, taking into account the calendar (unixmilli)

planned_resolve_at.title: planned resolve time calculated on-flight by sla and conditions, taking into account the calendar (unixmilli)

status.title: initialized from service/subservice of the catalog, should not be changed when service changed

close_reason_group.title: defines what close reason lookup we should use for this case, should not be changed when service changed

assignee.title: contact that assigned to resolve this case (optional)

reporter.title: contact that reported that issue, if null - anonymous contact

impacted.title: contact that can be impacted by this case, by default the reporter of the case, can be null if reporter is anonymous contact

status_condition.title: case state value from the status_lookup

close.title: close information, required when case is in final state

rate.title: rating information, not required (filled by internal services)

timing.title: planned timings calculated on-flight by the SLA and it's conditions

id.description: Main identifier for read, update, and delete operations.

ver.description: Version number of the comment, used for concurrency control.

created_at.description: Timestamp (in milliseconds) of when the comment was created.

updated_by.description: User who last updated the comment.

updated_at.description: Timestamp (in milliseconds) of the last update.

edited.description: Indicates if the comment was edited; true if created_at < updated_at.

case_id.description: Optional relation to the associated case.

casesCaseComment.description: Represents a comment associated with a case.

next.description: Flag to indicate if more pages are available.

items.description: List of comments on the current page.

casesCaseCommentList.description: Contains a paginated list of comments.

next.description: Indicator if there is a next page.

casesCaseFileList.description: Contains a list of case files with pagination.

updated_at.title: UpdatedAt timestamp of the status condition

created_by.title: CreatedBy user of the status condition

updated_by.title: UpdatedBy user of the status condition

casesStatusCondition.title: StatusCondition message represents a status entity with metadata

casesStatusConditionList.title: StatusConditionList message contains a list of StatusCondition items with pagination

casesStatusList.title: StatusList message contains a list of Status items with pagination

resolved_at.title: actual time when this case was resolved

reacted_at.title: actual time when this case changed it's status from initial

difference_in_reaction.title: difference between actual and planned reaction time, taking into account the calendar

difference_in_resolve.title: difference between actual and planned resolve time, taking into account the calendar

id.title: Unique identifier of the close reason

created_at.title: CreatedAt timestamp of the close reason

updated_at.title: UpdatedAt timestamp of the close reason

created_by.title: CreatedBy user of the close reason

updated_by.title: UpdatedBy user of the close reason

webitelcasesStatus.title: Status message represents a status entity with metadata

webitelcasesType.description:
Represents a source type for the source entity.

 - TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified source type.
 - CALL: Phone call source type.
 - CHAT: Chat source type.
 - SOCIAL_MEDIA: Social media source type.
 - EMAIL: Email source type.
 - API: API source type.
 - MANUAL: Manual source type.
